sentences: Delphine's persona and content has garnered curiosity and scrutiny from online users and media outlets alike.
section: == Media reception and public image == | === Surrealist eroticism of content ===

sentences: Various outlets, including Business Insider, The Cut, Kotaku, and Polygon have described her as a "troll", and several instances of her activity online as "stunts".
section: == Media reception and public image == | === Surrealist eroticism of content ===

sentences: Many of those outlets also assert that Delphine's often erotic content has a satirical and ironic layer to it.
section: == Media reception and public image == | === Surrealist eroticism of content ===

sentences: Business Insider cited one fan response in particular, which likened Delphine to a "2019 Andy Warhol".
section: == Media reception and public image == | === Surrealist eroticism of content ===

sentences: Referring to her as "a surrealist troll that became too much for Instagram", the publication also ranked Delphine 89th on the 2019 edition of its UK Tech 100 list.
section: == Media reception and public image == | === Surrealist eroticism of content ===

sentences: The list's purpose is to feature the one-hundred "most interesting, innovative, and influential people shaping the UK tech scene".
section: == Media reception and public image == | === Surrealist eroticism of content ===

sentences: The intentionally "weird" aspect of Delphine's social media presence has been often noted in media coverage of her.
section: == Media reception and public image == | === Surrealist eroticism of content ===

sentences: Alex Galbraith, writing for Complex, commented that her "exceptionally weird" stunts "seem to be satirizing the whole idea of sexiness".
section: == Media reception and public image == | === Surrealist eroticism of content ===

sentences: Writing for Vice, Kitty Guo described Delphine's humour as "tongue-in-cheek and deliberately gross-out", and commented that her modelling shots have a "slick glamour".
section: == Media reception and public image == | === Surrealist eroticism of content ===

sentences: Bishop wrote that Delphine "has successfully tapped into an online subculture by creating content that exists somewhere between Internet pranks and erotic modelling.
section: == Media reception and public image == | === Surrealist eroticism of content ===

sentences: For many of her followers, Delphine is a personality before she is a pornographic model".
section: == Media reception and public image == | === Surrealist eroticism of content ===

sentences: Aoife Wilson, Head of Video at Eurogamer commented positively on Delphine's online persona and content, asserting that "[Delphine] is an incredibly savvy businesswoman.
section: == Media reception and public image == | === Surrealist eroticism of content ===

sentences: She gained a huge online following through her love of cosplay and her ability to replicate real-life ahegao faces.
section: == Media reception and public image == | === Surrealist eroticism of content ===

sentences: She's kept that momentum going by engaging with her followers and trying new things, always skirting the line between sexy and surreal.
section: == Media reception and public image == | === Surrealist eroticism of content ===

sentences: She absolutely knows her audience".
section: == Media reception and public image == | === Surrealist eroticism of content ===

sentences: Writing for Kotaku, Joshua Rivera opined that the overt sexuality in Delphine's content was presented satirically, "given her long list of stunts that all tend to subvert or toy with well-established fetish tropes".
section: == Media reception and public image == | === Surrealist eroticism of content ===

sentences: On the sexuality found in her social media posts, James Cook of The Telegraph commented on Delphine being "one of a new breed of mostly young social media celebrities to have found a way to harness obsessive, sexualised internet culture to make huge amounts of money", albeit in a "dubious fashion".
section: == Media reception and public image == | === Surrealist eroticism of content ===

sentences: Delphine has also been noted to be often accused of making herself look younger, particularly to "cater to followers' barely-legal fantasies," due to her regularly using fake braces and styling her hair into pig tails in her posts.
section: == Media reception and public image == | === Surrealist eroticism of content ===

sentences: Delphine herself views her modelling as falling into the category of erotica, but in December 2020, when asked on if she considers her online activity as performance art, Delphine disputed the idea.
section: == Media reception and public image == | === Surrealist eroticism of content ===

sentences: Instead, she described her actions as "just jokes," and went on to say she enjoys "playing" around online, calling the internet "a really fun place to tease and mess around with".
section: == Media reception and public image == | === Surrealist eroticism of content ===

sentences: Her content's use of themes from Japanese popular culture has also been examined.
section: == Media reception and public image == | === Surrealist eroticism of content ===

sentences: Originating in 1990s Japanese manga, the ahegao facial expression was specifically cited by media outlets for its frequency and prominence in Delphine's imagery.
section: == Media reception and public image == | === Surrealist eroticism of content ===

sentences: Business Insider stated Delphine was "most famous" for her ahegao photos, while The Spectator referred to her replication of the facial expression as her "break-out" online.
section: == Media reception and public image == | === Surrealist eroticism of content ===

sentences: Dickson wrote that the references to Japanese culture in Delphine's content have sparked criticism, as she has been "accused of racism and cultural appropriation in her cosplay, as well as capitalizing on the eroticisation of young girls".
section: == Media reception and public image == | === Surrealist eroticism of content ===

sentences: Conversely, Japanese adult performer Marica Hase stated "I see her manga characters as more of an homage and not racist".
